eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.helpers

Interface ItemTouchHelperCallback.ViewHolderCallback

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExpandableViewHolder, FlexibleViewHolder
    Enclosing class:
    ItemTouchHelperCallback

    public static interface ItemTouchHelperCallback.ViewHolderCallback
    Internal Interface for ViewHolder to notify of relevant callbacks from ItemTouchHelper.Callback.
    This listener, is to intend as a further way to display How a ViewHolder will display the middle and final activation state.

    Generally the final action should be handled by the listeners FlexibleAdapter.OnItemMoveListener and FlexibleAdapter.OnItemSwipeListener.

    Since:
    23/01/2016

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.view.View getFrontView()
      On Swipe, override to return the Front View.
      android.view.View getRearLeftView()
      On Swipe, override to return the Rear Left View.
      android.view.View getRearRightView()
      On Swipe, override to return the Rear Right View.
      boolean isDraggable() 
      boolean isSwipeable() 
      void onActionStateChanged(int position, int actionState)
      Called when the ItemTouchHelper first registers an item as being moved or swiped.
      void onItemReleased(int position)
      Called when the ItemTouchHelper has completed the move or swipe, and the active item state should be cleared.

    • Method Detail

      • onActionStateChanged

        void onActionStateChanged(int position,
                          int actionState)
        Called when the ItemTouchHelper first registers an item as being moved or swiped.
        Implementations should update the item view to indicate it's active state.

        FlexibleViewHolder class already provides an implementation to handle the active state.

        Parameters:
        position - the position of the item touched
        actionState - one of ItemTouchHelper.ACTION_STATE_SWIPE or ItemTouchHelper.ACTION_STATE_DRAG.
        See Also:
        FlexibleViewHolder.onActionStateChanged(int, int)

      • onItemReleased

        void onItemReleased(int position)
        Called when the ItemTouchHelper has completed the move or swipe, and the active item state should be cleared.

        FlexibleViewHolder class already provides an implementation to disable the active state.

        Parameters:
        position - the position of the item released

      • isDraggable

        boolean isDraggable()
        Returns:
        true if the view is draggable, false otherwise

      • isSwipeable

        boolean isSwipeable()
        Returns:
        true if the view is swipeable, false otherwise

      • getFrontView

        android.view.View getFrontView()
        On Swipe, override to return the Front View.

        Default is itemView.

        Returns:
        the item Front View

      • getRearLeftView

        android.view.View getRearLeftView()
        On Swipe, override to return the Rear Left View.

        Default is null (no view).

        Returns:
        the Rear Left View

      • getRearRightView

        android.view.View getRearRightView()
        On Swipe, override to return the Rear Right View.

        Default is null (no view).

        Returns:
        the Rear Right View
